title: JJ's Girl On Show
text:
Politics | 20 October 2015 01:32 CET JJ's Girl On Show By Daily Guide 
Dr Ezenator Rawlings yesterday launched her campaign, her most spectacular yet, to win the National Democratic Congress (NDC) primary for the Klottey Korley constituency scheduled to take place on November 7, all things being equal. 
She had her father – former President Jerry John Rawlings – supporting her with a fatherly testimonial when he said of his daughter, 'I respect her a lot because she is selfless and truthful.' 
The former military leader told the gathering to disregard claims that his daughter does not hail from the area as being churned out by her opponents. 
Ezenator has the incumbent MP, Ishmael Nii Armah Ashietey, to beat to lead the NDC in that swing constituency. 
Mr Rawlings also admonished delegates of the party to desist from taking monies from candidates to vote for them, adding that his daughter is the best person for the Klottey Korle job. 
He pointed out that his daughter was born and bred in the constituency and had always had the desire to serve the people. The campaign launch was laced with pomp and pageantry, with Ezenator riding on horseback to the campaign ground like Jesus' triumphant entry into Jerusalem. 
The aspiring parliamentary candidate also rode on horseback during a recent health walk that climaxed the rally at the Mandela Park at Osu in Accra. 
Dr Rawlings asked the NDC faithful to shun those who would seek to buy their votes during the rally which climaxed her campaign launch. 
'The power is yours; you have the power. Don't let anyone pay you to take away that power,' she said. 
Continuing, she assured residents of the constituency that she would, through wide consultations, put together a development plan for the electoral area which she would implement when she came to power. 
The plan, she explained, would focus on issues the constituents themselves had raised during her engagement with them, which cover education, sanitation, health and employment. 
Dr Ezenator said, 'There are several corporate institutions and companies in the constituency. I will impress upon these companies to have a quota system in place where all of them will be required to provide employment for the constituents.' 
Ezenator Rawlings has been active in the constituency for some time now, as if to dispel the charge by her opponents that she had never partaken in matters affecting the electoral area until now, and therefore not qualified to vie to represent the party – something her supporters have denied. 
She also organised a clean-up exercise recently during which her father showed up to lend her (Ezenator) moral support as he did yesterday. 
Her father's equestrian gene appears to be in her. She was on horseback in her campaign walk along the streets of Osu yesterday, attracting inquisitive onlookers. 
She intermittently engaged street-side onlookers in talks about the importance of keeping fit through aerobics.
